subject: Gardening
title: Food Webs in the Garden
description: A quick, practical guide to Food Webs in the Garden.

hook.text: When a gardener kills all aphids, ladybugs leave. Then a new pest arrivesâ€”and there's nothing to eat it.

buildup.text: Gardens run on food webs: plants feed herbivores, herbivores feed predators, predators keep herbivores in check.

discovery.text: Removing one linkâ€”even a pestâ€”can cascade through the web, causing unexpected outbreaks of other species.

twist.text: The healthiest gardens tolerate some pest damage. A few aphids feed the ladybugs that prevent an aphid explosion.

climax.text: Managing a garden ecologically means managing the web, not eliminating individual species from it.

punchline.text: A few pests keep predators around for the big ones.

quiz.question: Why can eliminating all aphids from a garden cause problems?
options: Aphids are essential pollinators for most vegetables
Ladybugs leave without food, leaving the garden vulnerable to new pests
Aphid waste fertilizes the soil around plant roots
